singlecell_input_mapper.singlecell_input_mapper.scalar_field

Created on Mar 27, 2012

@author: regger

Classes

ScalarField([mesh, origin, extent, spacing, ...])

implements 3D scalar field based on numpy array used for e.g.
class singlecell_input_mapper.singlecell_input_mapper.scalar_field.ScalarField(mesh=None, origin=(), extent=(), spacing=(), bBox=())[source]

Bases: object

implements 3D scalar field based on numpy array used for e.g. sub-cellular synapse distributions modeled after vtkImageData; i.e. regular mesh with extent[6], spacing[3], and boundingBox[xMin, xMax, … , zMax]

get_mesh_coordinates(xyz)[source]

does NOT perform range checking; index may be invalid!

get_scalar(xyz)[source]

does perform range checking; however, if outside of bounding box, simply returns 0, so use with caution!

get_voxel_bounds(ijk)[source]

returns bounding box of voxel given by indices i,j,k. Does NOT perform bounds checking!

get_voxel_center(ijk)[source]

returns 3D center of voxel given by indices i,j,k. Does NOT perform bounds checking!

resize_mesh()[source]

resize mesh to bounding box around non-zero voxels also updates extent and boundingBox
